column4: I've managed to get Apache working and an example webpage setup on this PC, problem is when I try to connect to it using it's networking IP address the other computer can't connect, what am I doing wrong? It used to be able to connect
where can you connect from? local only?
yeah using 127.0.0.1 other then that it keeps on timing out, is it because of a firewall? I'm trying to access through a router...
yep it will be the firewall
unless I installed it whilst trying to set up the server I only have a firewall on my router
where is the pc accessing the page on the lan or coming in through the firewall/router
hmm? I don't get you, all I do is type in 192.168.0.2 which is this PC's IP on the network...if you mean the port, I'm not entirely sure
are you trying to access the webpage from a pc other than the one which apache is running on?
yeah I have two PCs one which is running apache another which is not, I want to access the PC's webpage with Apache with the one without apache
is that pc on a local network or connecting into your network from the internet?
local network, I have yet to work out how to access via the itnernet
oh give me a mo
what error do you get when trying to access the page
The Server 192.168.0.2 is taking too long to respond, I'll just mess around with some firewall settings, what ports would be used for the other PC to access this one?
ok :)
try /etc/init.d/iptables shutdown
how do I restart it, and what does it do?
what will that do?
turn off the iptables firewall on the machine
ok
command not found
good luck im off home
